page_analysis.text_content:
Accessory structures site planning

Fig 24 Examples of site planning solutions for accessory structures

A Combo garage / small pool cabana (side by side)
• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
b. be no more than 12' high
c. comply with accessory-structure daylight plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the side lot line so that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.

B Stand-alone pool cabana
• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
b. be no more than 12' high
c. comply with accessory-structure daylight plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the rear lot line so that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink, toilet, and shower and is greater than 200 sf, so it requires a CUP.

C Office above garage
• Structure is located within the buildable area, so it doesn't have to comply with regulations for structures in the required yards and it may be two stories high.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.
• Structure is new 2nd floor addition and therefore subject to the Planning Department's Individual Review (IR).

Note: Site planning for accessory buildings differs from that for parking structures in one way. A special allowance enables garages to be located in the rear/side yards even when the lot is not deep enough to maintain the 75' minimum distance from the front lot line. This does not apply to non-parking accessory structures.

Note: Because this structure is 2 stories, it must be located within the buildable area regardless of the distances from the lot lines and is subject to Individual Review (IR)

visual_elements.description: Fig 24 shows three schematic site planning examples for accessory structures: A) Combo garage / small pool cabana (side by side), B) Stand-alone pool cabana, and C) Office above garage. Each example includes a site plan diagram illustrating the location of the accessory structure relative to the main dwelling, lot lines, yards (rear, front, interior side, street side), and required setbacks. The diagrams use shading and labels to differentiate between the main dwelling, accessory structures, buildable area, required setbacks, sidewalks, lot lines, and curbs. Dimensions such as 'Min. 75'' from front lot line and '3' min.' setback are indicated with arrows. The diagrams also show plumbing fixture counts and fire rating requirements for walls and roofs where applicable.
visual_elements.location: Bottom half of the page, spanning full width

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum distance from front lot line for accessory structures in rear yard
Maximum height for accessory structures in rear yard
Number of plumbing fixtures for combo garage / small pool cabana
Number of plumbing fixtures for stand-alone pool cabana
Minimum size threshold for stand-alone pool cabana requiring CUP
Minimum setback for office above garage from street side yard

subheadings: A Combo garage / small pool cabana (side by side)

additional_notes: Page number 31 at bottom right corner.

Two 'Note:' blocks present: one at top right explaining special allowance for garages in rear/side yards, another near 'Office above garage' diagram explaining 2-story structure location and review requirement.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Text and diagrams are clear and legible.
cross_references: Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32 referenced twice for accessory-structure daylight plane compliance.
Planning Department's Individual Review (IR) referenced for new 2nd floor addition and 2-story structures.

qualifiers.text: Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
Structure is located right at the side lot line so that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
Structure is located right at the rear lot line so that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
Structure is located within the buildable area, so it doesn't have to comply with regulations for structures in the required yards and it may be two stories high.

conditions.text: be at least 75' from the front lot line
comply with accessory-structure daylight plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
wall and the roof must be fire rated
Structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink, toilet, and shower and is greater than 200 sf, so it requires a CUP.
Structure is new 2nd floor addition and therefore subject to the Planning Department's Individual Review (IR).

logical_relationships.expression: Structure is located in rear yard so it must: a. be at least 75' from the front lot line AND b. be no more than 12' high AND c. comply with accessory-structure daylight plane.
If structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink, toilet, and shower and is greater than 200 sf, THEN it requires a CUP.
If structure is new 2nd floor addition THEN it is subject to the Planning Department's Individual Review (IR).

execution_sequence.action: Verify structure location in rear yard and check conditions c1, c2, c3 for minimum distance, height, and daylight plane compliance.
If structure is located at side or rear lot line, ensure wall and roof are fire rated.
For stand-alone pool cabana, check plumbing fixtures and size to determine if CUP is required.
For office above garage, confirm structure is within buildable area and subject to Individual Review if new 2nd floor addition.
